hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Aliyah al-Riahi: The Prophet ﷺ said: Learn Islam, and when you have learned it, do not turn away from it. You must follow the straight path, for the straight path is Islam. Do not distort it right or left. You must follow the Sunnah of your Prophet ﷺ and his companions before they killed their leader, before they did what they did. I read the Quran before they killed their leader, before they did what they did, for fifteen years. Beware of these matters that create enmity among people.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by one who heard from Ibn Sireen: The Prophet ﷺ mentioned a trial and brought it near. Then a man passed by with his head covered. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'This one is upon the truth on that day.' Then Ka'b ibn Ujrah stood up and grabbed his arm, then turned his face towards the Prophet ﷺ and said: 'Is this him, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: And he uncovered his head, and behold, it was Uthman.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Waqid al-Laithi: We went out with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ before Hunayn. We passed by the Sidrah tree. We said: O Messenger of Allah, make for us a tree with hanging places like the disbelievers have a tree with hanging places. The disbelievers used to hang their weapons on a Sidrah tree and gather around it. The Prophet ﷺ said: Allah is the Greatest! This is like what the Banu Israel said to Musa: Make for us a god like they have gods. [Quran 7:138] Indeed, you are following the Sunnah of those who came before you.

He said: And there will be monkeys and pigs in this community.

hadiths.english_translation: A man narrated to us about a woman who came to one of the wives of the Prophet ﷺ and said to her: Pray to Allah to free my hand. She said: What is the matter with your hand? She said: I had two parents. My father had much wealth, much kindness, much virtue, or as she said, much charity. But my mother had none of that. I never saw her give charity at all, except that we slaughtered a cow and she gave fat to a poor person in his hand and clothed him with a rag. Then my mother died and my father died. I saw my father at a river giving people water to drink. I said: O father, have you seen my mother? He said: No. Did she die? She said: I said: Yes. Then I went seeking her and found her standing naked with nothing on her except that rag and that fat in her hand. She was striking it against her other hand and sucking its trace and saying: O my thirst! I said: O mother, shall I give you to drink? She said: Yes. So I went to my father and took a vessel from him and gave her water in it... Someone standing near her said: Whoever gave her to drink, may Allah cause his hand to be paralyzed. She said: Then I woke up and my hand had become paralyzed.

The people will extract him from his house unwillingly. They will pledge allegiance to him between the Corner and the Standing Place. An army will be sent against him from the Levant. When they reach al-Baydaa, they will be swallowed up by the earth. Then the groups of Iraq and the righteous ones of the Levant will come to him and pledge allegiance to him. He will extract the treasures and distribute the wealth. Islam will be thrown on its side to the ground. He will live in that for seven years, or as he said, nine years.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Khudri: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ mentioned a trial that will afflict this community until a man finds no refuge from oppression. Then Allah will send a man from my family, from my household. He will fill the earth with justice as it has been filled with oppression and injustice. The dweller of the heaven and dweller of the earth will be pleased with him. The sky will not withhold from its rain anything except that it pours it down abundantly. The earth will not withhold from its water anything except that it brings it forth. The living will wish for the death of the dead. He will live in that for seven years or eight or nine years.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ayyub as-Sakhtiyani: From Ibn Sireen: From Abu al-Jald: He said: There will be a trial, then another trial will follow it. The first one will not be in the Hereafter except like the tip of the whip followed by the flies of the sword. Then there will be a trial in which nothing forbidden to Allah will remain except that it is made permissible. Then the people will gather upon their best man. His authority will come to him pleasantly while he is in his house.

hadiths.english_translation: From Matar: Ka'b said: The Mahdi is named so because he does not guide people to a matter that has been hidden. He said: And he will extract the Torah and the Injil from a land called Antioch.

chainIssues: Matar is classified as Majhul al-Hal (unknown condition) without documented reliability from hadith scholars.
The hadith is mawquf (stopped at Ka'b al-Ahbar) rather than marfu' (attributed to the Prophet ﷺ). Ka'b was a Jewish scholar who converted to Islam, and this represents his own interpretation.

Ka'b al-Ahbar's reports, especially about unseen matters and future events, require careful scrutiny. Some scholars caution against accepting Ka'b's isra'iliyyat (Jewish sources/stories) without explicit corroboration.
The content about extracting Torah and Injil from Antioch appears to be from Jewish literature sources (isra'iliyyat) rather than Islamic sources.

potential_issues.issue: Matar is a narrator of unknown condition (Majhul al-Hal) whose reliability is not established.
potential_issues.impact: The unknown reliability of Matar affects the chain's overall strength.

potential_issues.issue: This hadith is mawquf (stopped at the companion Ka'b al-Ahbar) not marfu' (attributed to the Prophet ﷺ). It represents Ka'b's interpretation rather than a direct prophetic statement.
potential_issues.impact: A mawquf hadith has less authority than marfu'. Furthermore, this is specifically Ka'b's own statement about the Mahdi.

potential_issues.issue: Ka'b al-Ahbar was a Jewish scholar before converting to Islam, and his reports often contain isra'iliyyat (Jewish sources and stories). This particular statement about extracting Torah and Injil from Antioch has characteristics of isra'iliyyat.
potential_issues.impact: Reports from Ka'b about supernatural matters and future events should be treated with caution, especially those that appear to be derived from Jewish sources. This should not be accepted as definitive Islamic doctrine without other reliable Islamic sources.

Topics: Ka'b al-Ahbar's explanation of why the Mahdi is named as such
Extraction of Torah and Injil from Antioch
